Rationale: Starting with Tradition opener provides +3 Culture immediately, which is crucial for early social policy acquisition. This supports our conquest strategy by giving faster access to military-focused policies and helps our capital grow stronger. The capital focus also synergizes well with our EarlyExpansion strategy, creating a power base before expanding outward.

Justice is the optimal first Tradition policy for our conquest strategy. The +1 Production in every city accelerates our military production and expansion, crucial since we're already behind Venice (13 territory) and Korea (9 territory) on this tiny map. More importantly, cities with garrisons gain +25% Ranged Combat Strength - this perfectly complements our NeedRangedEarly strategy and the Chariot Archers we're about to unlock with The Wheel. This will make our cities much harder to attack while boosting our ranged forces, essential for our territorial expansion before all land is claimed.

Authority is the optimal choice for our conquest strategy. It provides +25% combat bonus against barbarians (giving experience to our young military), Culture/Science from kills (accelerating our development), and +1 Production in every city (critical with only 1 city). This will help us scale militarily to challenge Venice's territorial dominance. The completion bonus (Alhambra + faith-purchased military units) perfectly fits our long-term conquest goals.

Authority branch is essential for our conquest strategy.
